intro: Erigeron kraussii, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Erigeron kraussii is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
